intro: Phyllanthus empetrifolius, commonly known as the stonecress or false stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and typically grows as a low-growing shrub or herb. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-yellow in color. Its leaves are often thick and waxy, adapted to withstand arid conditions. It is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its hardy nature and unique appearance.
